intro: Clermontia hanaensis, commonly known as Hana Mountain Clermontia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its slender, evergreen stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats at high elevations. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom during the summer months. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is classified as endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
